resources:
PrivacyBuddy Timeline of when apps used your location in the past %1$d days 

Click on an access to get more information Timeline of when apps used your location in the past 24 hours
Location usage for
Welcome to PrivacyBuddy. This app is a prototype designed to test a built-in OS service created by Tristan Pelgrims and Maxime Bellis for their thesis.

Choose a data file, the app will load into the privacy dashboard with the data you choose.

We invite you to explore the app as if you are reviewing your own data from the past week.
Precise: Uses GPS or similar services to access the device's exact location with high accuracy. Approximate: Determines the general area of the device using Wi-Fi, cell towers, and less precise methods.
Foreground: Accesses location while the app doing the location access is in use. Background: Accesses location in the background, without user interaction, like weather updates during other phone use. Subliminal: Obtains location data when the phone is not in use, such as during sleep mode when the phone is resting on a table. When your phone is turned off completely, no accesses can be done.
Privacy dashboard Choose app to show Showing accesses in last %1$d days Showing accesses in last 24 hours
LocTimelineActivity
Accuracy, measured in meters, indicates the radius of the circle around the accessed location within which your actual location will be. With this accuracy of %1$d meters, the app knows you were in %2$s Bearing, measured in degrees, indicates the direction of travel. It represents an angle between 0 and 360 degrees, measured clockwise from true north.
Location access by
Datastream 1, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person was often in Leuven and north of Leuven. Datastream 2, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person is all around Leuven but stays close. Datastream 3, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person was active all around and in Leuven. This person had a high frequency of location accesses done.> You are a tutor of 22 years old based in Leuven. You don't really care about privacy and are very active on social media. You have a car and also tutor in the municipalities around Leuven, but most sessions happen in Leuven itself. You study Law, go to classes and enjoy the Leuven nightlife a bit, but you always go to sleep on time and turn on airplane mode. 

 This is simulated data! Do not make any conclusions based on the amount of accesses or the apps doing them. Datastream 4, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. Datastream 5, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person was active all around Flanders. Datastream 6, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person was active all around Flanders. Datastream 7, this is a real datastream from an anonymous person that lives in Belgium. While all the accessed locations and timestamps are real, the apps and all other extra information is simulated. Do not make conclusions about the apps featured. 

 This person was often around Rotselaar.
Apps ordered by This is a list of all your apps ordered by the amount of location accesses they did. If an app did not do location accesses they are not featured. This list ranks your apps by their privacy score, where a higher score indicates better privacy practices. This list shows your apps ordered by the frequency of location accesses, with more frequent accessors listed first. Access total Access frequency Privacy score
Privacy scores require more than one day of data to ensure accuracy of the calculation. Privacy Score is derived by analyzing daily app accesses: less frequent and less intrusive accesses lead to a higher score. Penalties are applied based on access type and frequency, reducing the base score of 100.
